intro: Crotalaria luteorubella, commonly known as the yellow-rust crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with a red throat. The plant has palmately compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it may be invasive in some areas.
